core

Class Robot

  • java.lang.Object
    • core.Deletable
      • core.Entity
        • core.Robot
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EnergyRelated

    public class Robot
extends Entity
implements EnergyRelated
    A class of robots, able to move and turn around given their energy-level, which must by all times be lower than the robot's capacity.
    Version:
    5.2.3
    Author:
    Brecht Gosselé & William Mauclet 2BiR: wtk-cws (Gosselé) en cws-elt(Mauclet)

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Robot(Orientation orientation, EnergyAmount energy)
      Initialize this new robot with given orientation and given energy-amount.

      • isValidCapacity

        public static boolean isValidCapacity(EnergyAmount capacity)
        Check whether the given double capacity is of positive value and lower than the maximal value the capacity of a robot can have.
        Parameters:
        capacity - The new capacity of the robot.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given double capacity is of positive value and lower than the maximal capacity a robot can have. |result == (capacity.isStrictPositive() && capacity.compareTo(Robot.getMaxCapacity()) <= 0)

      • canHaveAsEnergy

        public boolean canHaveAsEnergy(EnergyAmount energy)
        Check whether the given energy is of positive value and lower than this robot's capacity.
        Specified by:
        canHaveAsEnergy in interface EnergyRelated
        Parameters:
        energy - The energy-value to check.
        Returns:
        True if and only if the given energy is of positive value and lower than or equal to this robot's capacity. |result == (energy.isPositive() && energy.compareTo(getCapacity()) <= 0)

      • dropItem

        public void dropItem(Item item)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                     java.lang.NullPointerException
        Drop the given item. If this robot is on a board, the given item is given the same position as this robot. Otherwise the given item's new board is null and it is not carried by a robot.
        Parameters:
        item - The item to be dropped.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - The item is null. |item == null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - This robot does not carry the given item. |!carriesItem(item)

        Parameters:
        item - The item that must be checked if it is carried by this robot;
        Returns:
        A boolean telling whether this robot carries the given item. |let | boolean trueOrFalse = false | for each other in getLoad() : | if(other == item) | trueOrFalse = true |in | result == trueOrFalse

      • getHeaviestItem

        public Item getHeaviestItem(int i)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Return the i'th heaviest item in the robot's ArrayList load.
        Parameters:
        i - The degree of relative heaviness of the seeked item in the robot's load.
        Returns:
        The i'th heaviest item in the robot's ArrayList load. |let | int strictBigger = 0 | for each item in getLoad() : | if(item.getWeight() > getLoad().get(i - 1)) | then strictBigger++ |in | strictBigger <= i-2 | result == getLoad().get(i - 1)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given index i is bigger than the number of items carried by the robot. |i > getLoad().size()-1

      • getSquareInDirection

        public Position getSquareInDirection(int i,
                            Orientation orientation)
        Return the i'th position in the given direction of the robot.
        Returns:
        If the i'th position in the given direction of the robot is not out of bounds, return it. |let | Position newSquare = getPosition() |in If the given orientation is up, the returned position has the robot's coordinates, except that the y-coordinate is decreased by one. | if(orientation == Orientation.UP) then newSquare = Position.returnUniquePosition(getPosition().getX(),getPosition().getY() - i) If the given orientation is right, the returned position has the robot's coordinates, except that the x-coordinate is increased by one. | if(orientation == Orientation.RIGHT) then newSquare = Position.returnUniquePosition(getPosition().getX() + i,getPosition().getY()) If the given orientation is down, the returned position has the robot's coordinates, except that the y-coordinate is increased by one. | if(orientation == Orientation.DOWN) then newSquare = Position.returnUniquePosition(getPosition().getX(),getPosition().getY() + i) If the given orientation is left, the returned position has the robot's coordinates, except that the x-coordinate is decreased by one. | if(orientation == Orientation.LEFT) then newSquare = Position.returnUniquePosition(getPosition().getX() - i,getPosition().getY()) | | result == newSquare

      • getAllSquaresInDirection

        public java.util.ArrayList<Position> getAllSquaresInDirection()
        Return all the positions in front of the robot till the end of the board.
        Returns:
        An ArrayList containing all the positions in front of the robot. |let | ArrayList allPositions = new ArrayList() | int index = 0 | if(robot.getOrientation() == Orientation.UP) then index = (int) robot.getPosition().getY() | if(robot.getOrientation() == Orientation.RIGHT) then index = (int) (robot.getBoard().getWidth() - robot.getPosition().getX()) | if(robot.getOrientation() == Orientation.DOWN) then index = (int) (robot.getBoard().getHeight() - robot.getPosition().getY()) | if(robot.getOrientation() == Orientation.LEFT) then index = (int) robot.getPosition().getX() | | for each i in 1..index-1 : | allPositions.add(getSquareInDirection(i, robot.getOrientation())) |in | result == allPositions

        public void move()
          throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                 java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                 java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Make the robot move one position forward.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - The robot is not on a board. |getBoard() == null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - The new position-to-be of the robot is out of the robot's board's bounds. |getSquareInDirection(1,getOrientation()) == null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The new position-to-be of the robot contains an obstacle to the robot. |getBoard().containsObstacle(getSquareInDirection(1,getOrientation()),this)

      • turnClockwise

        public void turnClockwise()
        This method makes the robot turn 90° in clockwise direction. The robot's energy-level is decreased by the energy needed to turn.

      • turnCounterclockwise

        public void turnCounterclockwise()
        This method makes the robot turn 90° in counterclockwise direction. The robot's energy-level is decreased by the energy needed to turn.

        public void teleport()
              throws java.lang.NullPointerException
        This method puts the robot on another random square of the board.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - The robot isn't placed on a board. |getBoard() == null

      • getEnergyRequiredToReach

        public EnergyAmount getEnergyRequiredToReach(Position position)
                                      throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                             java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Return the minimal energy required for this robot to reach the given position.
        Parameters:
        position - The target-position for which this method calculates whether this robot can reach it, and with what minimal energy- consumption.
        Returns:
        If the robot does have enough energy to reach the given position, the returned result is the minimal energy required for the robot to reach that position. |let | ArrayList range = getExtendedRange(this, null) |in | for each robot in range : | if(robot.getPosition() == position) | returnValue.hasSameValueAs(getEnergy().substract(robot.getEnergy()) | | result == returnValue
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - The robot is not placed on a board. The message of the IllegalStateException is "-1". |getBoard() == null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - The given position is theoretically not reachable because of obstacles. The message of the IllegalStateException is "-1". |!getBoard().isPositionReachableForRobot(position, this)
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - The robot hasn't got enough energy to reach the given position. The message of the IllegalStateException is "-1". |let | ArrayList range = getExtendedRange(this, null) |in | !range.contains(position
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The given position if out of the robot's board's bounds. |!getBoard().isValidPosition(position)

      • moveNextTo

        public static void moveNextTo(Robot robot1,
              Robot robot2)
                       throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                              java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Move both given robots the closest possible to each other. If both robots haven't got enough energy to end up next to each other, a best effort should be made so that the final distance is minimal. If multiple final combinations of positions are possible for the two given robots, the least energy-consumptive combination shall be selected.
        Parameters:
        robot1 - One of the two robots that need to move next to each other.
        robot2 - One of the two robots that need to move next to each other.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - At least one of the given robots is null. |robot1 == null || robot2 == null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - The two robots are not located on the same board. |robot2.getBoard() != robot1.getBoard() || robot1.getBoard() == null || robot2.getBoard() == null

      • executeProgram

        public void executeProgram()
        This method makes the robot execute a given program (or instance of the class Command).
        Parameters:
        command - The program/command the robot needs to execute.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - No program is stored in the robot. |getProgram() == null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - The robot isn't placed on a board. |getBoard() == null

        public void executeNSteps(int n)
